summary: The bill, titled the "Freedom from Regulatory Enforcement and Evaluation of Speech Policies to Ensure Editorial Choice Holds Act of 2025" (FREE SPEECH Act of 2025), prohibits the Federal Communications Commission (FCC) from compelling entities regulated by the Commission to align their speech with the political ideology of any presidential administration. This includes restrictions on rules, orders, merger approvals, and any other approvals required by the FCC, effectively safeguarding editorial independence.
